author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Hindu Makkal Katchi submitted a petition to the City Police Commissioner office on Saturday requesting that the Celebrity Cricket League (CCL) be conducted after elections.

Members of the organisation said that holding the event prior to the elections would pave the way for political parties to hold campaigns aided by CCL.

They said that the cricket tournament which was going to be held on April 17 in the city could be made use of by all political parties to garner votes.

“There are chances that partymen would distribute tickets free to people or give them free food,” said D. Gurumoorthy, general secretary, State Youth Wing, of the organisation.
title: Hindu Makkal Katchi plea to put off CCL
